data.name: Potsdam Bike Tour with Rail Transport from Berlin
data.description: Take a day-trip from Berlin and discover UNESCO World Heritage listed Potsdam, all by the seat of your bike! From park lands to alleyways, you're English-speaking guide will recount historical anecdotes as you explore an array of Prussian and Cold War sites.

data.name: Skip the Line: Olympiastadion Berlin Entrance Ticket
data.description: The Olympiastadion Berlin unites sports, history, architecture and modernity. Explore the stadium on a self-guided tour and see a documentary film in the visitor center. For an inimitable tour-experience here in the Olympiastadion Berlin, you will get a free mobile multimedia guide from Samsung including headphones in our visitor center. Multimedia guides are available in German, English, Spanish, French an Italian (November to March until 2pm, April to October until 4pm and in August until 5pm).

data.name: LEGOLAND Discovery Centre Berlin Admission Ticket
data.description: Discover the ultimate LEGO® indoor playground where creativity and fun is our first priority. Over 5 million bricks, exciting play areas and fun rides under one roof are awaiting you!

data.name: 90 Minute Segway Rental in Berlin
data.description: See the sights of Berlin on a self-balancing Segway, and marvel at top attractions at your own pace. Get an overview of Berlin and its diversity in an hour's time, passing landmark sites such as the Holocaust Memorial, Reichstag Building and Potsdamer Platz.

data.name: Berlin: Private Half-Day Walking Tour
data.description: This is a great overview tour through the city of Berlin for everyone who would like to learn a lot of details and background information, as well as experience the atmosphere of the city. This informative and entertaining city tour takes you to the famous sights and boulevards of Berlin, such as the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Holocaust Memorial or remnants of the Berlin Wall. We sometimes use public transport - usually double-decker buses - to get from one interesting city district to the next. Your personal local guide will be happy to accomodate any wishes you may have. Let Berlin inspire you!

data.name: Berlin Private Tour in a Minivan with Driver and Local Guide
data.description:
Book a minivan with driver and a local guide for a unique experience of Berlin! You will be picked up at your hotel in Berlin and the tour can be individually designed based upon your preferences and needs. After booking, you may send us a message with further instructions.

Our friendly and competent guides will be glad to accomodate any wishes you may have with regard to the tour. Such as breaks for shopping, a child seat in the car, the visit of a typical German brewery or the visit of a specific site.

We would be glad to welcome you to Berlin and show us our exciting city!

data.name: Berlin bike Tour
data.description:
Admire Berlin from different angle on a hassle-free tour that shows you the best of this beautiful city.
Benefit from a more personalized experience as you explore the city in a small group, receiving insider tips from your professional guide. Glide through the Gendarmenmarkt , see the imperial Berlin Palace, and explore the heart of the city. Towards the end of your tour, pass the famous Checkpoint Charlie before heading down to Potsdamer Platz, where you will enjoy plenty of photo opportunities.

data.name: Berlin Historic Center, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie Tour
data.description: Discover Berlin’s history on this 4-hour tour with your own private driver and guide. See Berlin’s historic center, walk through the Brandenburg Gate, see the Reichstag, drive through the old border at Checkpoint Charlie, and come to terms with Berlin’s dark Nazi past at the book-burning memorial. Your guide will show you all this and more as you uncover the tortured past and fantastic present of Germany’s capital city, all from the comfort of your private air-conditioned vehicle.

data.name: Berlin Street Art Tour
data.description:
Street Art may have been born elsewhere, but Berlin made it its own. Beginning with paintings in the 1960's on the western side of the Berlin Wall and carrying through Berlin’s free-spirited 1990's, street-artists from all over the world have left their mark on the capital.

Looking for the hidden corners of Berlin? What’s new, who’s who, and where the freshest and finest works Berlin has to offer will all be covered by the expert street art guides. Explore Berlin's fun and sensational side by joining this tour and making sure your trip has that extra special twist to bring back home with you.

data.name: Berlin City Tour on Segway
data.description: Join this 60 or 120 minute small group city tour and explore Berlin conveniently on a Segway. Your guide will take you to all the main attractions as well as some hidden sights in Berlin as you cruise through beautiful parks and gardens and visit some of the most photogenic places of the city.

data.name: Berlin Segway Rental
data.description: See Berlin's top sights and explore the city at your own pace. See an overview of the diversity of Berlin in short time by renting a Segway scooter to discover this beautiful city on your own.

data.name: Private Half-Day Third Reich Walking Tour
data.description:
This tour will take you back to the history. Learn all about the Nazis' rise to power, Hitler's plans for Berlin and his end in the bunker. See the authentic site of the former heart of the Nazis' government area and the headquarters of their terror regime.

On this tour you will see the location of Hitler's bunker in which he committed suicide and you will walk along the former government area of the Nazis where they planned the Second World War and the Holocaust. We will also see the building of Goering's Aviation Ministry and the site of Hitler's New Chancellery.

The tour ends at the site where the State Security Police had its headquarter and where you will visit an exhibition about the Nazi's terror regime.

data.name: Berlin Walking Tour: WWII History, Wall, Chocolate Factory
data.description: Berlin, known for its cultural landmarks and history, has evolved through the ages. Explore the political changes that have impacted the city, and discover how Berlin has reinvented itself to emerge as one of the hottest spots to visit in Europe. On our ultimate Berlin travel experience, you'll visit original sites of World War II and the Holocaust, visit remnants of the Berlin Wall, enjoy delicious samples from the oldest chocolate factory in the city and more. Your guide will be equipped with booklets of photos, maps and original documents, making this tour experience all the more memorable.

data.name: Berlin Small-Group Walking Tour of Hidden Sights, Back Streets
data.description: Discover what the former East Berlin was really like on this unique experience; from cultural traditions and anarchic rebellions to dividing walls and creative fervour, this tour will take you behind the scenes of the real East Berlin.

data.name: Small Group Walking Tour of East Berlin with a French Guide
data.description: This tour will go beyond an standard “East/Communist Berlin Tour”. We will visit places to understand Berlin’s history as the capital of East Germany. You will visit with a French speaking Guide the Wall Memorial at the Bernauerstrasse. You will take a look to one of the former "ghost stations"  and will talk about the communist architecture at the famous former Stalin Allee and go the "East Side Gallery".

data.name: BERLIN FASHION TOUR by bike
data.description: Berlin makes it possible to have a cool urban lifestyle without buying from mainstream commercial brands. Meet the movers & shakers of Berlin's sustainable scene and let them introduce you to their forward-thinking concepts. You'll experience Berlin's coolest green-upcycle fashion stores, local designer atelies, fair-trade and vegan products, edgy vintage shops and many more.  Let's cycle around Kreuzberg and Neukölln together, just like a Berliner does on a typical Saturday afternoon.

data.name: 3-Hour Private Berlin Bike Tour: Vibes of Berlin
data.description: Discover the alternative Berlin with your private group and guide on a 3-hour bike tour along the banks of the river Spree. Pedal your way through colorful Berlin, stopping in the hip districts and learning about the city's history.

data.name: E-Scooter Rental Berlin
data.description: See the sights of Berlin on an electric Scooter, and marvel at top attractions at your own pace. Get an overview of Berlin and its diversity in an hour's time, passing landmark sites such as the Holocaust Memorial, Reichstag Building and Potsdamer Platz.

data.name: 3-Hour Private Bike Tour of Tiergarten and Berlin's Hidden Places
data.description: Enjoy a private 3-hour bike tour through Berlin and see the city's hidden places and green ways -- even Berliners are amazed on this tour! See centrally located treasures and hear incredible stories. This tour is the perfect route for all who feel like Berlin experts or are searing for the unusual.

data.name: Tours & Sightseeing in English of Berlin, Potsdam and Sachsenhausen
data.description:
A luxury tour at budget prices. You will be collected and returned to your hotel in a climate-controlled vehicle. All this for €42 per person! In the allocated time you will see more of the city than on any tour and hear original soundtracks of speeches by Kennedy, Reagan and Hitler at those exact locations where they spoke. We are all experts on the city. Our mission is to inform without boring you with a plethora of dates, focusing on the human angle and bringing to life the famous and infamous personalities who, for better or worse, have left their mark. Our presentation is witty, but insightful and we don't shy away from controversial opinions or questions. Each group receives a FREE CD containing captioned photos of all the listed sights. The duration is two to three riveting hours and you will see all the sights listed below.

The all-inclusive price for the Berlin City Tour is €42 per person.

data.name: Private Berlin 3-Hour Bike Tour: Berlin's Best
data.description: Experience the City of Berlin by bike in a relaxing 3-hour guided tour. Get a perfect mixture of all the central sights of past and present, added with insights into original locations from the Cold War and Nazi-time. This tour is a perfect welcome to Berlin, as it offers a great synopsis of the German capital.

data.name: 3-Hour Alternative Berlin Bike Tour: Vibes of Berlin
data.description: Discover the alternative Berlin by bike on a 3-hour bike tour along the banks of the river Spree to the hip districts. See the famous colorful Berlin, a city in constant renewal and find out why the city is called "poor but sexy".

data.name: Third Reich and Berlin Wall History 3-Hour Bike Tour in Berlin
data.description: Enjoy a 3-hour bike tour and experience Berlin's 20th century history off the beaten tourist trail. Learn about the capitals history during the Nazi period, the construction of The Wall and daily life in East and West shown at original places.

data.name: 3-Hour Berlin Highlights Bike Tour
data.description: Enjoy a relaxed yet comprehensive 3-hour city tour introducing you to Berlin’s top sites.  You will see top attractions, such as the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Reichstag, and much more.  Discovering Berlin by bike is a truly memorable experience, and friendly English-speaking guides will captivate you with interesting stories and insights into the city.  This is the perfect tour for those looking to see the best Berlin has to offer in one concise tour.

data.name: Private Photo Tour in Kreuzberg
data.description: This photo walk combines city knowledge and photo knowledge in a unique way. If you are curious about the stories behind the history of otherwise hidden motifs, this is the right place for you. Since 2009, we have been inspiring new photographic perspectives and passing on extensive knowledge in the field of image design to the participants. Our guides are local photographers with insider knowledge about the city, which is an essential part of the visit.

data.name: Berlin Segway Tour with Guide, Small Group
data.description: Get to know the highlights of Berlin on a 2-hour city tour by Segway. Following an expert guide, cruise around central Berlin to discover the city’s fascinating history and famous sights including Checkpoint Charlie, the Berlin Wall, the Holocaust Memorial and the Topography of Terror. Explore Potsdamer Platz, glide around Brandenburg Gate and enjoy trivia about Berlin along the way. Numbers are limited to 8 on this small-group tour, ensuring personalized attention from your guide.

data.name: Berlin Bike Tour: Third Reich and Nazi Germany
data.description: How could the Germans allow Hitler's rise to power? Who, if anyone, stood in his way? What was known of the extent of the Holocaust, and what was done against the persecution of the Jews and others? What was life in Berlin like during the Third Reich and during the bombing of World War II? What happened in Berlin once the Soviets defeated the Nazis? Find out on this fascinating Berlin Bike Tour.

data.name: Segway Tours Berlin Wall - Private Group
data.description: Explore Berlin by 1, 2 or 3-hour (depending on option selected) guided Segway tour. Cruise through Berlin in a small-group and admire the reunited capital, its highlight and beautiful sights along the former Berlin Wall run and on the Spree riverside. See sights such as Brandenburg Gate, Castle Bellevue, Reichstag, Gendarmenmarkt, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial and lot more (depending on tour option selected).

data.name: BODY WORLDS Berlin
data.description:
The first BODY WORLDS museum presents a variety of unique plastinates that show the function of individual organs as well as common diseases. It gives insights into the highly complex structures of the human body and shows what connects us, keeps us upright and in motion, and what makes us laugh and love.
Moreover, the exhibition opens the visitors’ eyes to various facets that determine our existence.

data.name: Skip the Line: Mauermuseum Checkpoint Charlie Entrance Ticket Berlin
data.description:
Our museum was founded shortly after the construction of the Wall (13 August 1961), and opened on 19 October 1962. "As closely as possible to injustice is where human greatness reveals itself the most," said our museum's founder Dr. Rainer Hildebrandt. So he used the museum at Checkpoint Charlie as an expression of protest against the Wall, and to help those in need. The museum grew over time and helped bring the Wall down. The museum has helped write history.

.

data.name: East Berlin & the Wall
data.description: Learn everything you need to know from an expert Berlin guide on a 2-hour walking tour! Discover how Germany was divided into the capitalist West and the communist East after World War Two. See where Berlin was ripped in two, literally overnight, by the Berlin Wall. Follow the path of the Wall and discover tragic stories of loss, daring escapes, and the nefarious East German secret police, the Stasi.

data.name: Berlin Highlights Small-Group Segway Tour
data.description:
When you visit Berlin for the first time, this is the ideal tour for you. On this 3-hour tour, an experienced tour guide shows you the most famous sights of the German capital. You’ll see top attractions like Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie and the historic Nicholas Quarter. Besides having fun driving the Segway, your guide will give explanations at each tour stop and you’ll learn about the history of this exciting city. Numbers are limited to 6 on this small-group tour, ensuring personalized attention from a guide.
• 3-hour Segway Tour to Berlin’s most famous sights
• Your expert guide will give explanations at each stop
• Learn about the history of the city
• Have fun driving the Segway through Berlin's vibrant streets: We only use original Segway PT
• Small-group format ensures a personalized experience

data.name: Berlin Wall And Cold War Walking Tour in Berlin
data.description: Join this guided Berlin walking tour and learn about Berlin Wall and the Cold War in the city. See the main sights of the Cold War in Berlin and learn about the historical background of this once divided city and the life of Berlin's citizens during the Cold War.

data.name: Berlin's Gay, Lesbian, and Queer Scene Small-Group Walking Tour
data.description:
A queer king, a gay mayor, Marlene Dietrich in Blue Angel, David Bowie in the ‘70s, Audre Lorde in the ‘80s: Berlin has long been a magnet for LGBTIQ icons and allies.
From the wild days of the 1920s and the dark days of persecution under the Nazis through to the Cold War. Hear about the club scene of the 90s, the unlikely queer icon Frederick the Great, and the life of the openly gay Nazi, Ernst Röhm. Explore world-famous, Schöneberg, once the central district of the sapphic Berlin, home of philosopher and war journalist Erika Mann, chronicled by painter Otto Dix and writer Christopher Isherwood.
Discuss the queer community of Berlin and all the communities it intersects with by visiting Kreuzberg, where as far back as the 1600's, many waves of LGBTIQ and immigrant diasporas have come to determine "nobody flees without a reason".
On this tour we accept anyone that considers themselves LGBTIQ, an ally, or who’s just plain interested. Everyone is welcome!

data.name: Berlin Small-Group Segway Tour
data.description: Cruise effortlessly through Berlin's parks and sidewalks as you view the sites by Segway! A self-balancing, personal transportation device that's designed to operate in any pedestrian environment, your Berlin Segway Tour is limited in size (a maximum of 8 participants per guide), so you can count on an extremely personal experience.

data.name: Berlin Craft Beer Tour
data.description:
Learn about Berlin's brewing history, experience a customized bar-route, and taste the emerging craft beer scene. With our local beer experts you’ll head to some of the best bars in Berlin!

Note: **1st March 2020: ticket price reduction (16€) to allow clients to purchase own drinks!**
On the Craft Beer tour your expert guide will teach you all about the brewing process, and take you to three of the most exciting bars serving locally-brewed beers. We keep up with the scene and make sure that we go the best new bars for the freshest brews, meaning that this tour is different almost every night!
How is one of the best beer tours in town also one of the cheapest?
The beers are on you! At each location your guide will tell you about a whole host of different beers, from creamy stouts and tangy sours to hoppy IPAs and traditional pilsners, what you (responsibly) drink is up to you! Order a round of tasters, or get a sneaky one in before it’s time to move to the next place, you do you.

data.name: Berlin 3-Hour Bike Tour: City-Center Welcome
data.description: Experience the awakening Berlin by bike in a relaxing 3-hour guided tour. Get a perfect mixture of all the central sights of past and present, added with insights into original locations from the Cold War and Nazi-time. This tour is a perfect welcome to Berlin, as it offers a great synopsis of the German capital.

data.name: Berlin Christmas Markets Walking Tour
data.description: Get into the spirit of the season by visiting three of Berlin's Christmas markets on a walking tour. A dazzling array of handcrafted goods, traditional food and drinks teem from the popular spots on this Berlin Christmas tour. Purchase a ‘Glühwein’ — the hot mulled wine that is a staple of the markets — that will have you feeling warm and cozy in no time. Your guide shares German Christmas traditions and the history of nearby sights such as Schloss Charlottenburg (Charlottenburg Palace) and the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church.

data.name: Berlin Wall Behind the Iron Curtain Private Walking Tour
data.description: Unveil the fascinating history of the Cold War and the Berlin Wall on this private walking tour led by an expert historian guide. Learn about the rise of the Iron Curtain after World War II and hear how the Soviet Union collapsed with the fall of the Berlin Wall. See pieces of history come together on an enlightening 4-hour stroll to the sites where it all took place, such as the Berlin Wall memorial at Bernauer Strasse, Karl-Marx-Allee boulevard, Gethsemane Church and Bornholmer Strasse.

data.name: Private Day Tour to Potsdam from Berlin by Minivan
data.description:
Visit beautiful Potsdam, a city nearly completely listed as UNESCO World Heritage Site. Enjoy the relaxing gardens and palaces on a private day tour in a minivan.

Potsdam city is known for its famous picturesque gardens and palaces. The city is close to Berlin, where the tour will start. Part of the tour is a visit of Glienicke bridge, the "Bridge of Spies", and of Cecilienhof Castle, where the famous peace conference after WWII took place. Another highlight of the tour is a visit of Sanssouci Palace inside and a walk through the beautiful park area.

For our lunch break we will head to the romantic baroque city center of Potsdam with its Dutch Quarter or you may want to visit a historic restaurant closeby.

data.name: Discover Potsdam
data.description: Spend the day exploring the German city of Potsdam, once home to Prussian kings and the German Kaiser, during this 6-hour guided walking excursion. Explore the numerous palaces, castles and parks of this beautiful city, a location some have compared to France’s Versailles, on foot, listening to insightful commentary from your guide as you go.

data.name: The Original Berlin Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp Memorial Tour
data.description: Take a tour of the Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp with The Original Berlin Concentration Camp Memorial Tour. Discover the brutal history of the facility that was primarily used for political prisoners but also the administrative center of the Nazi concentration cap system.

data.name: Berlin Private Tour with Warnemuende Port Transportation
data.description: Leave your cruise ship behind at Warnemuende Port and visit Berlin on a full-day shore excursion with a private guide! Traveling by both minivan and on foot, get to know the city’s highlights on a comprehensive guided tour. The itinerary is flexible so if there’s something you want to see more or less of, simply let your guide know! Sites that you may visit include the Berlin Wall, Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Cathedral and Potsdamer Platz. Learn about the city’s history and soak up its cultural energy with personalized attention from your guide!

data.name: Original Berlin Pub Crawl and Nightlife Clubbing tour
data.description:
This Original Berlin pub crawl is your ticket to the best night out in the city. Come crawl with us as we get into some of Berlin's best clubs, pubs, lounges, and dance halls.

Here is your ticket for a good night out! Need to know the best place to go? Don’t worry we have it covered. Come hang out with us, as we find our way into some of Berlin’s best nightlife!

data.name: Segway Sightseeing Tour Berlin
data.description: The Exclusive Segway Tour – is a trip, that we are definitely proud to present. Our best ideas are inside. Our guides are professionally prepared to teach you to drive Segway and are always ready to share with you the most interesting and exciting facts about the history of Berlin. You always have a possibility to choose one of several options, that we offer special for you. It’s an amazing way, how to spend time with your nearest, and enjoy the city at the same time.

data.name: 1-Hour Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
data.description:
Discover Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point

See the Brandenburg Gate, one of the best-known landmarks in Germany

Visit the Holocaust Memorial, a memorial in Berlin to the Jewish victims of the Holocaust

Enjoy the ride on Segway at Gendarmenmarkt, where you will see an architectural ensemble of concert hall and churches

data.name: 3 Hours Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
data.description:
Discover Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point

Join to see the Brandenburg Gate, one of the best-known landmarks in Germany

Visit the Holocaust Memorial, a memorial in Berlin to the Jewish victims of the Holocaust

Explore the Reichstag building as well as the German Chancellery - places, where all the most important decisions are taken

Pass through the Rotes Rathaus, the town hall of Berlin, the home to the governing mayor and the government of the Federal state of Berlin

Enjoy Berlin Cathedral, one of the most beautiful churches in Germany

See the largest train station in all of Europe

data.name: Madame Tussauds Berlin Admission Ticket
data.description: Enjoy a visit to Madame Tussauds in Berlin with your admission ticket. Totally interactive Sets, amazing costumes, exciting music and modern techniques, it’s all inside. Experience your one-of-a-kind WOW moments and meet your idols closer than ever!

data.name: Government district, the Reichstag and the glass dome: a private tour
data.description: A visit of the glass dome on top of the Reichstag building is a must for every Berlin visitor! This tour brings you through the German government district and to the representation of the European Union in Berlin. You will get an insight knowledge of the political system of Germany while we get along the federal chancellery and buildings with offices for the members of the parliament. After the tour you can get to the roof terrace of the Reichstag building and you will have access to the glass dome with a fascinating view over Berlin.

data.name: Charlottenburg Palace Orchestra Concert and 3-Course Dinner
data.description: Likely to Sell-out! 'An Evening at Charlottenburg Palace' Dinner and Concert by the Berlin Residence Orchestra regularly sells out weeks in advance. You will begin the evening with a three course candlelight dinner in a cozy ambiance located at the Charlottenburg Palace Orangery. The beautiful performance by the Berlin Residence Orchestra will complete your evening.

data.name: Berlin Private History Walking Tour: Wall, Checkpoint Charlie
data.description:
This private walking tour brings you to the places, where famous events of the Cold War happened and history was written. On this tour you will also see original pieces of the Wall, one of the last remaining guard towers and Checkpoint Charlie.

The tour starts at the Berlin Wall Documentation Center in the street "Bernauer Strasse", where many of the dramatic escape attempts took place, successful and tragic ones. You will ride one of the subways that were called "ghost trains" during the division of the city, so-called because of the gloomy atmosphere in the underground stations close to the wall. The tour also covers Checkpoint Charlie, the former military checkpoint and hot spot of the Cold War. This is the site where the fate of mankind was hanging by a thread in 1961 when US and Soviet tanks confronted each other.

data.name: Small Group Berlin Segway Tour
data.description: Explore Berlin by 1, 2 or 3-hour (depending on option selected) guided Segway tour. Cruise through Berlin in a small-group and admire the reunited capital, its highlight and beautiful sights along the former Berlin Wall run and on the Spree riverside. See sights such as Brandenburg Gate, Castle Bellvue, Reichstag, Gendarmenmarkt, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial and lot more (depending on tour option selected).

data.name: A great day in Berlin with a private guide
data.description:
Welcome to amazing Berlin.

We are Guides of Berlin and together we will discover, understand and have a memorable experience of Berlin.

On this VIP tour, we will visit the landmarks of Berlin, go beyond the beaten track to discover the magic that lured people here throughout history.

Together we will explore the richness of Berlin's history, culture and beauty.

A great tour for your easy orientation to the city.

My aim is a memorable experience for you.

Among the landmarks we will cover are the following sites:

Checkpoint Charlie

The German parliament- Reichstag

The Brandenburg Gate

The holocaust memorial

The Berlin Wall

The site of Hitler's Bunker

Gendarmenmarkt

The location of the book burning

Museum Island

Hackescher markt

The Berlin Cathedral

and more

data.name: Private Tour: Potsdam Day Trip from Berlin
data.description: Discover the former royal residence of Potsdam on this comprehensive private tour from Berlin. As you explore this city that has UNESCO World Heritage status, learn about its colorful history from your knowledgeable guide. Capture photos of the lovely castle of Babelsberg, the lakeside Marble Palace and the breathtaking Sanssouci Palace. You'll also see the Cecilienhof Palace -- site of the Potsdam Conference where the stage was set for the Cold War. Since this is a private tour, you can tailor the itinerary to suit your particular interests.

data.name: VIP Berlin with a Private Guide, Car, and Driver
data.description:
Welcome to amazing Berlin.

We are Guides of Berlin and together we will discover, understand and have a memorable experience of Berlin.

On this VIP tour, we will visit the landmarks of Berlin, go beyond the beaten track to discover the magic that lured people here throughout history.

Our driver will take us directly to the sights, avoiding queues and comfortably accessing the city sights.

Driving through wonderful Unter der Linden all the way to The German parliament--the Reichstag.

The fabulous Brandenburg Gate

The Holocaust Monument

Babel Platz--Location of the book burning

The Berlin wall

Check point Charlie

Gendarmenmarkt

The Royal City Palace

and much more.

data.name: Classic Segway Tour
data.description: Why walk when you can ride with us? The best way to explore Berlin is on our exclusive Segways. Discover one of the most beautiful cities in the world while enjoying a cruise through the parks and streets on an easy to use Segways.

data.name: Dresden and Meissen: private day tour from Berlin in a minivan
data.description: Visit Dresden and see the impressive historic city center and the embankments with views of the Elbe River. Enjoy a walking tour along all the famous sights of Dresden which ends at the Church of our Lady - the most beautiful church in Dresden which you can visit afterwards. After a lunch break we will continue to the city of Meissen: a walk through this charming old town with its narrow streets will end at the impressive Albrechtsburg castle, with its numerous medieval rooms - this visit will take you back to times long past. A day you will certainly remember!

data.name: Berlin Private Half-Day Bike Tour: The Wall, Cold War Sites
data.description:
Get an up close and personal view of the Berlin Wall with this informative and entertaining 4-hour guided bicycle tour along the Wall route. Ride through the Brandenburg Gate, closed for 28 years, along the Berlin Wall Memorial and to the Palace of Tears. Hear the history of the Wall along the way and learn the stories of people who tried to escape to West Berlin.

* 4-hour guided bicycle tour along the Berlin Wall route
* Learn about the history of the Wall and hear stories of people trying to escape East Berlin
* Ride through the Brandenburg Gate and along the sections where the Wall still stands
* This tour is great for history buffs

data.name: Culinary Tour Scene and East-Side-Gallery
data.description:
Explore the East-Side-Gallery and plunge in into the history of the cold war. Enjoy a goodie from a famous bakery. Discover street art and get a feeling of movement and liberty in the mulitcultural part of Kreuzberg. Taste in an historic market hall sausage and cheese as well as tofu and take a drink. You will be astonished. Discover typical Kreuzberg backyards and get a tasty arabian treat.

Finally enjoy a chocolate goodie from a lovely small manufacture.

data.name: E-Scooter Tour
data.description: Why walk when you can ride with us? The best way to explore Berlin is on our exclusive Scooters. Discover one of the most beautiful cities in the world while enjoying a cruise through the parks and streets on an easy to use Scooter. Our professional guide will take you to all the main sights in the city, cruise you through beautiful streets and squares, and visit some of the most photogenic places in Berlin, most of which you’d be lucky to stumble across on scooter!

data.name: Culinary City Tour through old Berlin
data.description:
We connect a sightseeing tour through old Berlin with gastronomical highlights of the typical Berlin kitchen.

Our tour starts at the Gendarmenmarkt, the nicest square in town. We stroll along Linden to Humboldt University, German Historical Museum and the new castle construction. Enjoy your appetizer, a handmade "Berliner Bullette", a meatball including salad and a small drink. 

Afterwards we continue to the famous museum island and the jewish quarter including the Hackeschen courts. Finally enjoy Rinderroulade with homemade potato dumplings and red cabbage with apples and for dessert red berry compote with vanilla sauce is served. Each dish includes a small drink.

data.name: East and West Berlin Private Half-Day Custom Sightseeing Tour
data.description:
Enjoy a private sightseeing tour along the main sights of the German capital. A minivan with driver and your English-speaking tour guide will be available all day. The tour starts at your hotel, is customized according to your interests which you may express at the beginning or during the tour and it includes several photo stops and short walks.

Head for Checkpoint Charlie, remaining pieces of the Berlin Wall and remaining guard towers. See sites of the Third Reich and the Cold War. Visit the famous Brandenburg Gate and the site of Hitler’s bunker where he committed suicide. See the Reichstag Building, the historical Prussian boulevard, the Museums Island and the rebuilt city castle of the former Emperors.

If you are getting hungry we will have a lunch break of your choice. You might prefer just a regular quick snack or you may want to taste a Curry Sausage – Berlin’s popular local dish. Upon your request we will be happy to visit a restaurant with German cuisine.

data.name: Culinary Tour Kreuzberg de luxe
data.description:
Explore Kreuzberg, one of the hottest places in Berlin. Enjoy an original Berlin sausage at famous Curry 36. Discover typical Kreuzberg backyards and get a tasteful mustard and chutney tasting.

Have a great view from the top of the Kreuzberg with its national monument and enjoy a beer tasting.

Dive in the multicultural life of the Chamissokiez, a completely preserved Wilhelminian-style quarter and enjoy other delicious tastings in an old market hall.

data.name: Guided Tour Highlights & History
data.description:
Highlights & History Tour

You will visit a lot of Highlights like Potsdamer Square, Hitler Bunker, Holocaust Memorial, Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag.

In the same time we walk along the former death strip including information's and photos about the Berlin Wall.

data.name: Charlottenburg Palace Berlin Residence Orchestra Tickets
data.description: Likely to Sell-out! 'An Evening at Charlottenburg Palace' Concert by the Berlin Residence Orchestra regularly sells out weeks in advance. Book ahead of time to avoid disappointment.

data.name: Street Art Tour - Off The Grid
data.description:
Artists tell you the secrets, the history, the techniques, the rules and the personal stories of graffiti and street art in a walk through a city whose walls are canvasses. A comprehensive history of graffiti and its culture.

Berlin's air is thick with paint. Its soundtrack is the clack-clack of a spraycan in the night. Tags tell as much of a story as five storey murals, a blast from a high pressured fire extinguisher can be as expressive as a centuries old canvas from a Dutch master. And we know the history and the culture of it all. Let artists themselves show you the sweetest spots and the finest pieces, whilst giving a comprehensive history of urban art in its modern day Mecca.

See huge murals, heaven spots and and throw-ups. Learn about trainbombing and tagging, stencils, paste-ups, stickers and everything in between. Tour includes Urban Nation gallery. Covers Kreuzberg, Friedrichshain and Schöneberg.

data.name: Private Berlin Wall and Third Reich History 3-Hour Bike Tour
data.description: Enjoy a private 3-hour bike tour and experience Berlin's 20th century history off the beaten tourist trail. Learn about the capitals history during the Nazi period, the construction of The Wall and daily life in East and West shown at original places.

data.name: Russian Berlin Walking Tour
data.description: Join this 2-hour guided walking tour and visit the former Russian district of Berlin, the meeting point of Russian refugees after the Soviet Revolution of 1917.

data.name: Historical Cemeteries of Berlin Walking Tour
data.description: Explore German history on this 2-hour walking tour of historical cemeteries in Berlin. See some of the historically most important cemeteries of the city.

data.name: Trabi Safari Berlin
data.description:
Explore Berlin's urban jungle in the famous Trabi! You get to drive the most iconic car of the former GDR: an original and straightforward driving adventure like you've never experienced it before. 

You and your co-drivers will discover Berlin's georgous architecture and its unique historical past. Experience history up close by driving the Trabi, one of the remnants of the former German Democratic Republic.

Led by our specialised and passionate guides we will take you on a Trabi Safari!

data.name: Skip-the-Line AquaDom & SEA LIFE Berlin Ticket
data.description: Dive into the fascinating world under the sea and experience the exciting and beautiful underwater world.

data.name: Private Tour from Berlin to Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp
data.description:
Experience a comprehensive visit of the former Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp, just north of Berlin with your local private guide.

With your local tour guide you will visit different sites and exhibitions in the memorial area of the concentration camp that imprisoned thousands and murdered many during WWII. Visit the execution sites, punishment cells, crematoriums and learn how about life used to be as a prisioner of this concentration camp.

Learn about the history of the camp and the Nazi party as you gain insight into one of history's biggest tragedies.Your guide will be glad to answer all your questions you may have with regard to Germany’s history and the rise and fall of Hitler and the Nazis.

To get to Sachsenhausen public transportation will be used or optionally an air-conditioned minivan with driver.

data.name: Best of Berlin Segway Tour
data.description: Explore Berlin by Segway and spin to top attractions in style . Hop on your Segway and following a little practise head into bustling Berlin with a guide. Explore iconic squares such as Pariser Platz and Potsdamer Platz, and take in famous landmarks including Brandenburg Gate, the Holocaust Memorial, the Reichstag Building and the Victory Column. Along the way, gain insight into Berlin’s rich history and find out what makes the city tick.

data.name: 2-Hour Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
data.description:
Visit Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known crossing point in the Berlin Wall

See the Brandenburg Gate, one of the most famous landmarks in Germany

Experience the Holocaust Memorial, a haunting tribute to the Jewish victims

data.name: Friedrichstadt-Palast Show in Berlin with VIP Option
data.description: Enjoy a breathtaking performance at Berlin’s iconic Friedrichstadt-Palast theater!  For its current production, VIVID Grand Show, futuristic stage sets, impressive video installations and creative lighting design form a breath-taking work of art. The creative team – working in five different time zones and 15 cities – couldn’t be more international! The final flourish: Philip Treacy, “the world’s most famous milliner” (THE TIMES).The London-based Irish hat maker is responsible for design direction and Stefano Canulli (Paris/Rome) for the extravagant costume designs. Las Vegas-based director Krista Monson has produced shows for the Cirque du Soleil; she is assisted by co-director Oliver Hoppmann from Berlin. The stage set is by the American Michael Cotten, who has created shows for Michael Jackson, Miley Cyrus and Phil Collins as well as the Super Bowl and the Olympics.See more than 100 artists on the world's biggest theater stage, with your choice of different ticket options.

data.name: History Tour of Berlin: Cold War and Third Reich - private tour in a minivan
data.description:
Enjoy a comprehensive sightseeing tour along all the main sights in former West and East Berlin with an emphasis on Berlin's history, particularly on the Third Reich and Cold War.

Perfect for everybody who wants to get a first overview of the city and to get an insight into German history.

With your local tour guide and a minivan with driver we head towards the highlights, such as the great boulevards Kurfürstendamm and Unter den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag building, seat of the German parliament.

Learn about the sites of the Third Reich and visit the Holocaust Memorial. Discover how the division of the city was a consequence of WWII and how the Cold War affected the Germans. Of course we will also visit Checkpoint Charlie and the last remaining pieces of the Berlin Wall and site of Hitler's death.

The tour includes stops and short walks such as at the Brandenburg Gate and at Checkpoint Charlie.

data.name: Little Big City Berlin Entrance Ticket
data.description: Located at the foot of the iconic Berlin TV Tower (Berliner Fernsehturm), Little BIG City brings to life Berlin’s rich history in beautifully crafted 3D miniature sets. In just under an hour, experience seven periods of time in Berlin, from the birth of the city up to modern-day Berlin. View a magnificent cityscape of Berlin through time and discover the little stories behind the big events that shaped the city. Get closer to history than ever before at Little BIG City Berlin.

data.name: Hard Rock Cafe Berlin Including Meal
data.description: The Hard Rock Cafe Berlin sets the pace with great food and a veritable wall of Rock 'n' Roll memorabilia! One of Europe's best places to party, Berlin is the only European city lacking official closing hours, so drink up and enjoy through the wee small hours of the morning.

data.name: Berlin Reichstag cupola with coffee break at the rooftop restaurant
data.description:
Visit the new government quarter of Berlin and the guide will explain the history of this heart of German politics.

Get more information about the location and history of Berlin Wall.

Learn more about the fascinating history of the Reichstag building and it`s reconstruction after German unification.

Climb the world famous dome and get a perfect view at the German capital. The Guide will explain all historical landmarks of the city.

A coffeestop at the rooftop is included in the tour.

data.name: Berlin Historical Bike Tour: Berlin Wall and Cold War
data.description:
Join this extremely insightful four-hour tour, covering a leisurely 6 miles (10 kilometers) by bike. Your tour begins near Alexanderplatz where you'll area formerly known as East Berlin to visit the Wall plenty of sites that make Berlin the unique city it is today. On the Berlin Wall Bike Tour you will visit the Berlin Wall Memorial, see a former watchtower, visit the land once known as the no-man's land, see where the East German Secret Police kept their secret files, and learn about escape attempts in the places they took place.

Along the way, your guide will also tell you about ghost train stations, espionage, and world events all effected by the Wall. You'll gain insight into what life was like in the shadow of the Wall and how the city still copes with it's divided past today. Throughout the tour, your guide will be available to answer any questions you have about the Cold War and how it shaped present-day Berlin

data.name: Berlin Self-Drive Trabi Tour with Guide
data.description: Enjoy a 75-minute self-drive tour through Berlin in a retro-style Trabant. Following a guide, squeeze yourself behind the wheel of your own Trabi to explore the German capital in a unique way. You'll see sights such as Potsdamer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate, and receive a souvenir Trabant driver's license at the end of the tour. Select a morning or afternoon tour when booking.

data.name: Berlin Mitte Walking Tour: Wall, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag
data.description: Uncover Berlin's past and present on this enlightening 4-hour walking tour through Mitte, the city’s historic center. Walk along the Berlin Wall, stroll down Unter den Linden to Brandenburg Gate, see the Reichstag and Holocaust Memorial, hear the story behind Checkpoint Charlie and learn about the Topography of Terror museum. Listen as your guide ties important monuments, buildings and memorials to the city’s complex Prussian, Imperial, Nazi and Cold War past, weaving history into a detailed narrative. Compare these historical sights with modern marvels such as Potsdamer Platz and Friedrichstrasse.

data.name: Potsdam and Wittenberg: private day tour from Berlin in a minivan
data.description: This unforgettable day trip takes you first to the city of Potsdam. See its beautiful parks and castles, particularly Sanssouci Palace and its huge park. We will walk through the park and visit the Dutch Quarter afterwards - you will feel like in the Netherlands! Afterwards we will continue to the city of Wittenberg. After a lunch break in the historic city center you will discover the home town of Martin Luther. On the tour you will see the location of his former home which is a museum about his life today and you will visit the church, where Luther posted his famous theses on its doors.

data.name: Welcome to Berlin tour! Sightseeing, souvenirs and visit of a German brewery
data.description: Your local guide will be happy to welcome you at your hotel. Using public transportation you will get to Berlin's oldest place with its picturesque small houses and streets. You may visit small shops with typical German souvenirs and articles, such as cuckoo clocks and beer mugs. Afterwards we will walk through part of the eastern city center and see the town hall, the cathedral and the Museums Island. On the way the guide will give you a short introduction to Germany's history and will be happy to answer all your questions you may with regard to the country and its people. The tour ends at the "Hofbräuhaus" - a brewery with typical German atmosphere, beer and food. You will be served German beer and a pretzel - welcome to Germany!

data.name: Berlin Private Street Art Tour - Off The Grid
data.description:
Artists tell you the secrets, the history, the techniques, the rules and the personal stories of graffiti and street art in a walk through a city whose walls are canvasses. A comprehensive history of graffiti and its culture.

Berlin's air is thick with paint. Its soundtrack is the clack-clack of a spraycan in the night. Tags tell as much of a story as five storey murals, a blast from a high pressured fire extinguisher can be as expressive as a centuries old canvas from a Dutch master.
