data.name: Berlin Bike Tour
data.description:
There's no better way to see the sights and learn the history of Berlin than by joining a bike tour! You get to have fun and socialize, have some exercise and be entertained by your knowledgeable guide. It will be the best day you'll spend in Berlin!

Our 6-hour, deep dive into Berlin history will take you to the major sites and give you a glimpse into modern Germany. Our guides are locals who are passionate about their city and want you to enjoy it as much as they do. Plus, we'll stop at a Beer Garden for lunch (cost not included). This is the best way to see all of Berlin in a day and gain valuable insight to the monuments that make this city unique.

data.name: Private Half-Day Highlights And City Bike Tour of Berlin
data.description:
Enhance your experience of Berlin’s incredible sights and rich history on a private 4-hour bicycle tour of the German capital. Receive the undivided attention of your expert guide as you cycle, at a leisurely pace, past iconic attractions like the Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden. Discover hidden neighborhoods off the tourist trail; spend time reflecting at the poignant Holocaust Memorial; and get acquainted with the rich history and culture of the capital with your professional guide.

* 4-hour private bicycle tour of Berlin with an expert guide
* Discover iconic monuments like the Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden while cycling at a leisurely pace
* Spend time reflecting on Berlin's turbulent history at the Holocaust Memorial
* Receive the undivided attention of your expert guide on this private tour

data.name: VIP private Segway Tour
data.description: Take this 2 hours guided tour through Berlin and enjoy a ride on Segway. Cruise the most scenic landmarks of Berlin's historic city center on Segway and explore more neighbourhoods and sights close-by.

data.name: 2 hour 15 min Berlin Wall Self Drive Trabant Tour
data.description: Enjoy a 2 hours and 15 minutes self-drive tour of the Berlin Wall in the official car of the DDR (GDR) with a live guide. Squeeze yourself behind the wheel of a Trabant of your choice and get your very own souvenir Trabant driver's license at the end of your tour. See interesting sights as you putter around the German capital.

data.name: New York City Rockstar Bar and Nightclub Crawl
data.description: Enjoy a fabulous night out in New York City on this all-inclusive bar crawl. Join your party host and take advantage of NYC's electrifying nightlife as you visit several bars and clubs for drinks and dancing.

data.name: New York City Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour Uptown
data.description: Academic, spiritual, entertaining — who would've thought a tour could offer so much? But this Uptown loop delivers this and so much more. Enjoy the sights and sounds of Uptown Manhattan on this double-decker bus tour. Explore the historic neighborhood of Harlem and cruise along Central Park’s 5th Avenue border, dubbed New York City's 'Museum Mile.'

data.name: Downtown Manhattan Walking Tour
data.description: Come and explore the diversity of lower Manhattan with us on a two hour leisurely walking tour. This tour will give you a newfound understanding of New York’s history, financial importance and architectural beauty. Expect to see some of Manhattan’s oldest buildings, sites that featured in the American revolution, Wall street, the September 11th memorial and more. Lower Manhattan inspires awe in all who visit it, make sure you see it in all its glory with our walking tour, leaving every day from 145 Nassau street at 12:00.

data.name: Romantic Central Park Horse-Drawn Carriage Tour
data.description:
Central Park is probably the most famous and romantic park in the world. If you want to make a unique and special proposal or celebrate an anniversary, this ride is ideal. The tour includes a bottle of champagne to cheer for the  special occasion, a bucket of roses and pictures to memorize event!  If you would like to have a professional photographer take your photos during this special occasion, please visit our website www.neyorkcityadventure.com to make a booking with a professional photographer as an additional service. Following spots are popular for proposals: 
•            Bow Bridge: The most famous place to propose ever! Some people call it The Bridge of Love!  
•            Bethesda Fontaine & Terrace: This is likely the most recognizable place in Central Park.

data.name: New York City to the Hamptons Private Day Trip
data.description: Visit the Hamptons on this private, full-day trip from New York City with a chauffeured minivan that accommodates up to six passengers. Enjoy the ride in comfort and style, then spend the day seeing some of the most expensive and luxurious residential properties in the USA, with beautiful mansions and estates that slope down to the ocean's edge. Explore the streets of small villages, quaint shops, boutiques, art galleries, cafes and of course visit a winery.  Highlights of the trip include lunch by the ocean's edge.

data.name: Secrets of the High Line
data.description:
Small-sized group tours. Perfect for tourists AND locals New Yorkers too!

Learn lots of secrets about New York City's "Park in the Sky" and its surrounding neighborhoods. Built upon a historic freight rail line erected above the streets on Manhattan's West Side, the High Line has become a major draw for tourists and locals alike. This fun, two-hour guided walking tour includes a visit to Chelsea Market; the chic gastro haven was once the home of Nabisco, the birthplace of the Oreo cookie. Meandering the entire length of the unique and stunning elevated public park, you'll take in breathtaking views of NYC from an entirely new perspective.  You'll learn all sorts of area "secrets" through engaging narration throughout your tour. The tour covers the High Line's past and present, its art and area galleries, its horticulture, its surrounding neighborhoods, visible iconic buildings, future developmental plans and the latest cutting-edge architecture sprouting up all around the High Line.

data.name: Central Park Manhattan Guided Bike Tour NYC
data.description:
Explore Central Park with a 2-hour guided bike tour. All of our Central Park tour guides are licensed professionals.  All of our bikes are Trek or Giant brand bikes new to this model year with no tacky advertisements on them.  Your bike package is included with your tour purchase.  Some of the sites seen on this tour are Columbus Circle, The Central Park Mall, The Bethesda Fountain, The Conservatory Water, The Reservoir, The Conservatory Garden, The Great Lawn, The Belvedere Castle, Strawberry Fields, the Alice in Wonderland Statue, and Cherry Hill.  We provided one live tour guide per every 15 people in order to keep the tour groups small.

Adult bikes, child bikes, child trailers, child seats, and accessible hand cycles are all available.

Bike baskets are available.

Customer can reschedule for any reason at no additional cost.

data.name: Tribeca Architecture And History Walking Tour
data.description:
Whether you are visiting Tribeca for the first time or you've lived here your entire life, the Tribeca Architecture and History Tour has something for you. With over 300 years of history, Tribeca combines historical landmarks and brave architectural feats into one fascinating neighborhood. Tribeca has a distinct personality all on its own, so we decided to honor it with its own tour.

Join us to learn more about the buildings and sites you may otherwise walk past without ever knowing their stories. You'll quickly come to see that Tribeca, a former farmland, is now one of the most fascinating neighborhoods in New York City.

data.name: New York City Private Night Tour with Driver-Guide
data.description: THIS IS A SOCIALLY DISTANCED TOUR. Enjoy a private New York night tour, seeing and photographing beautifully lit sights around the city and taking in one of the world's most famous skyline from across the rivers in Brooklyn and New Jersey. This is a 3-hour tour and transportation is provided in a 2015 Toyota Sienna mini-van with the capacity to accommodate up to 6 guests. This is fantastic and memorable way to spend an evening in New York!  PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS PRIVATE DRIVING TOUR IS SOCIALLY DISTANCED FROM THE CROWDED CITY SIDEWALKS, SUBWAYS AND BUSES.

data.name: Central Park Secrets And Highlights
data.description:
Small-sized tour groups. Great for local New Yorkers, too!

Central Park is one of the most famously-known parks in the world and it has been featured in many television shows and movie productions such as Sex And The City, When Harry Met Sally, The Out-Of-Towers, Barefoot In The Park, Taxi Driver, Love Story, Home Alone 2, Ghostbusters and literally hundreds of others. This tremendous 843-acre oasis is overflowing with lush green lawns, colorful plantings and trees, woodsy areas and wildlife, public gathering spots, romantic alcoves, fun activities and loads of interesting places to explore!  It is a paradise for photographers, lovers, children, outdoorsy types, bird-watchers and anyone with an appreciation for nature, wildlife, art, beauty and fun times, regardless of age.

Your 2-2.5-hour guided tour through Central Park’s southern section covers Central Park’s fascinating history, its “secrets”, pop-culture and much more.  You’ll definitely want to bring your cameras for this one!

data.name: New York City to Amish and Mennonite Country Private Day Tour
data.description: Discover Amish Country on this day trip from New York City for up to five guests. Experience the everyday life of the Amish, their community, customs and culture on a private tour led by an Amish or Mennonite guide living in that community. Throughout the tour, there is first-hand exposure to the people, practices and places of the 40,000 Amish living in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania. Visit their farms, bakeries, markets, quilt shops, mills and more on this exciting and memorable visit.

data.name: NYC Electric Scooter Rental
data.description:
Quality - Our scooters are brand new, perfectly maintained, and ready to ride!

Variety - Whether you're looking to switch up your commute, go sightseeing, or get a quick adrenaline rush, we highly recommend trying these out!

Safety - Electric scooters are a new way for New Yorkers and visitors alike to get around the city efficiently while also avoiding crowded public transit.

Family Fun - Riding electric scooters is an excellent activity for families during holidays to have fun together!

data.name: Central Park Private Bike Tour
data.description: Customers can have a very personally tailored experience based on what they would like to see in Central Park. If there is a particular area or attraction, simply let your guide know and they will take you there!

data.name: Central Park Highlights Guided Electric Bike Tour
data.description:
A fact that may surprise you: Central Park has many hills, some of which are quite steep!

Touring the park using an electric bicycle allows you to zip through the entire 843 acre park without breaking a sweat!

Get a one-of-a-kind experience riding an elite piece of biking equipment through New York's iconic sightseeing destination, Central Park, with an enthusiastic and informative tour guide.

data.name: Guided Walking Tour Of Central Park
data.description:
Get to the root of Central Park with our 2-hour walking tour. Explore the most famous park in the world with this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. See the green, beating heart amid the hustle and bustle of New York City. Hear the distinct crunch of Central Park dirt beneath your feet as you enjoy your holiday adventure.

Your seasoned tour guide will be with you every step of the way on this journey to bestow on you the rich history of these incredible sights. Highlights include the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace, Conservatory Waters, Strawberry Fields, Central Park Mall, Jackie Kennedy Onassis Reservoir, the Great Lawn, Bethesda Castle, and more! Your desire for knowledge will be satiated by our comprehensive tour.

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Brooklyn Bridge and DUMBO
data.description: From a city of 30, 000 people at the time of the Revolution, New York City's population mushroomed to over a million eighty years later. The rise of the Brooklyn Bridge, the longest suspension bridge in the world at the time, represented the city bursting onto the world stage. After the great bridge rose out of the depths of the river floor to tower over the booming metropolis. Just three short years later the Statue of Liberty would rise in the harbor, and steel frames would allow buildings to reach for the stars, but it all started with the Brooklyn Bridge.

data.name: Philadelphia to New York City Private Day Trip
data.description: Relax on a private guided sightseeing tour of New York City, with pick-up in and return to Philadelphia. Custom itineraries are created and personalized for each guest. Options include iconic sights of the city, along with off-the-beaten path places that make New York such a special place. Transportation is provided in the comfort of a roomy 2015 Toyota Sienna mini-van, with the capacity to accommodate up to 6 guests. The driver-guide is a licensed professional. Take the anxiety out of touring New York City and take this private driver guided tour!

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Hidden Jewish Origins of Harlem
data.description:
Before Harlem became the epicenter of the African American experience it was a Jewish immigrant neighborhood. The Gershwin Brothers, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Milton Berle, Lane Bryant, Sophie Tucker and many many more got their starts in Jewish Harlem at the dawn of the 20th century.

The neighborhood is filled with synagogues, theaters, nickelodeons, department stores built by Jews for Jews that have been turned into churches, movie theaters, music venues, and political gathering sites that played a pivotal role in modern American history from the Great White Way to the Civil Rights movement. Harlem exemplifies the great "melting pot" of modern America.

data.name: Hudson River Greenway Bike Tour
data.description: New York: dazzling skyscrapers, rich history, stunning views, and a myriad things to do. Experience them all on our three hour bike tour of the Hudson river. If you enjoy stress-free waterside cycles, away from hectic city traffic, this is the tour for you. Our experienced guide will lead you down the island of Manhattan along the Hudson River Greenway, starting at Hell’s Kitchen and finishing on the other side of the Southern tip at the famous Brooklyn bridge. On this tour you can get off the beaten tourist track and soak up New York’s true spirit. You will of course see views of Lady Liberty, the High line, Wall street and the Brooklyn bridge, as well as discovering what New Yorkers do in their time off. From kayaking to outdoor cinemas, this area of the city that never sleeps is sure to inspire.

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Beats, Rockers, Punks of the West Village
data.description: We will explore one of the great epicenters of cultural energy in the U.S. from Mark Twain to the Ramones, Billy Holiday to Jimi Hendrix, this neighborhood fostered creative forces that would define epochs and change the world.

data.name: CharacTour of the Lower East Side
data.description: This is not just a tour, bur interactive theater on the streets! Accompanied by a tour guide throughout, the group meets an actor improvising four or five different characters from history along the way.

data.name: New York: Metropolitan Museum of Art Private Biblical Art Tour
data.description: With over 5, 000 years of civilization from around the globe represented in one of the world's great museums, a guided tour to ensure the "must sees" is a necessity! This tour navigates the world of the Bible, putting the stories of Abraham, Moses, David, Jonah, Daniel, the Maccabees, and Jesus into context. Hear familiar stories amongst the artifacts that the subjects would have been surrounded by during their lifetimes.

data.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art Private Biblical Art Tour
data.description: With over 5, 000 years of civilization from around the globe represented in one of the world's great museums, a guided tour to ensure the "must sees" is a necessity! This tour navigates the world of the Bible, putting the stories of Abraham, Moses, David, Jonah, Daniel, the Maccabees, and Jesus into context. Hear familiar stories amongst the artifacts that the subjects would have been surrounded by during their lifetimes.

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Jewish Colonial History in New York City
data.description: For anyone interested in the American Jewish experience, this tour explore the origin story of a community that has been contributing to the American story since the earliest days of colonization. Later American Jewish history is much more heavily explored, but seldom to we explore the stories of the first Jews to the continent, the first synagogue, and the Jews of the Revolution.

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Jewish Lower East Side
data.description:
A tour through the Lower East Side explores the story of immigrant life following the arrival at Ellis Island for Eastern European Jews. One of the most famous neighborhoods on earth, the Jewish Lower East Side hosted remarkable political, social, artistic, economic, and culinary movements that would help to define the modern American experience.

Come learn about the origins of the bagel, pastrami, kosher pickles, socialist movements, iconic department stores, and Hollywood film studios by visiting the Yiddish Forward Building, Eldridge St Synagogue, the Gershwin brothers' childhood home, a historic Loew's Movie Theater, Kossar's Bialys, The Pickle Guys, and a high school that minted many of the U. S. 's biggest movie stars.

data.name: Private Walking Tour: Wonders of Grand Central Terminal
data.description: Grand Central Terminal is an icon of NYC. Countless movies, tvs, (even cartoons!), have used the stunning temple of transport as the set for iconic cultural scenes. We'll see art stained glass from Tiffany's, where Edward R Murrow's studios were, hidden tennis courts, the best cocktail bar, and hear stories from U.S. history, ancient with the Vanderbilts and recent with Jackie O. This is a tour that has it all!

data.name: New York City Downtown Hop-On Hop-Off Double-Decker Bus Tour
data.description: This hop-on hop-off bus tour of downtown Manhattan lets you sightsee in New York City at your own pace. Pass through neighborhoods such as Chinatown, Little Italy, Greenwich Village, take a stroll in Central Park, or stop to explore in Times Square. You’ll hear live commentary via audio headsets on board.

data.name: Statue of Liberty and New York City Skyline Sightseeing Cruise
data.description: See many major New York sights on a 90-minute boat cruise on a 1920s-style yacht! Enjoy views from the open bow, or relax in the spacious climate controlled glassed-enclosed observation cabin. The boat cruises along the Hudson River offering views of Manhattan's west side and booming skyline. Pass by the Financial District, Ellis Island, and Statue of Liberty as the boat cruises into New York Harbor.

data.name: Private Horse-Drawn Carriage Ride of New York City
data.description: This magical evening horse-drawn carriage ride will take you through the world-famous fifth avenue shops passing by Tiffany Co., Trump Tower, Saint Thomas Church, Saint Patricks, Rockefeller Center, Avenue Of Americas, Radio City Hall, and ends with a relaxing ride through Central Park! Discover the beauty of New York City on this stunning evening tour!

data.name: Hop-On Hop-Off NYC Bus Tour, Statue of Liberty, and More
data.description: Enjoy hop-on hop-off bus tours, Statue of Liberty Cruise, Museum of the City of New York admission, and Central Park bike rentals with our various sightseeing options! All bus stops are located near NYC attractions, which makes it easy and convenient to explore the famous sites you want to see. Whether you are looking to sit back and take in the Downtown sites on our Downtown Single Loop Pass, hop on and hop off at major attractions, view New York from the water, or pedal through Central Park, there's an option that fits your needs!

data.name: NYC East Village Pierogi Food Tour
data.description: This seasonal tour runs from Tuesday, September 7, 2021 to Friday, May 27, 2022, it's the perfect time for stick to your ribs hearty samples. Enjoy a delicious 2-hour stroll through New York City's famous and colorful East Village, with its old world Eastern European eateries full of yummy pierogi, kielbasa, egg creams and baked goods.

data.name: Brooklyn Bridge Guided Walking Tour
data.description: Intimately explore the Brooklyn Bridge with our 2-hour walking tour. Experience the most beautiful sights in New York City on this world-famous bridge. See with your own eyes the diverse set of tan wood that carry millions of travelers between the boroughs year upon year. Cast your gaze at the warm glow of solid brick that spans the great divide that is the East River. Your seasoned guide will be at hand every step of the journey to provide you with a wealth of information relating to these sights. See where Manhattan and Brooklyn, these mighty boroughs, meet.

data.name: Central Park Horse Carriage Ride (Short Loop)
data.description: Welcome to Big Apples' short Central Park horse carriage tour! The tour starts at the corner of 59th street and 6th Avenue, following a short trip along the park on the 59th Street, the tour continues into the Central Park from 7th avenue with a nice view of the city. We stop at a point where the scenery is perfect to take pictures or just look around for a few minutes. Depending on where you look and what you see, the content of the tour changes. In NYC and central park, people around the US and the world gather in a festive atmosphere day and night, cold and warm! So, being on a horse carriage in Central Park where it is possible to have view of the city  in early evening and nights is like watching a panoramic view of the NYC, and its people who come from all around the world to meet at this city that "never sleeps!" This is a short, fun and relaxing experience. It is a "must do" in NYC!

data.name: Manhattan Skyline Night Cruise: 1.5 Hour Yacht Tour Plus Drink
data.description: Experience the bright New York City skyline with views from the water in New York Harbor on this night time cruise. Step aboard a 1920s inspired motor yacht and enjoy a private table in the main, climate controlled salon. Relax and take in the sights of Ellis Island, the Statue of Liberty and Governors Island along with sweeping views of the Manhattan skyline at night.

data.name: Lower Manhattan Secrets And History Walking Tour
data.description:
You can’t take a trip to New York City without touring Lower Manhattan. With a 400-year history, this vibrant neighborhood is bursting with landmarks, relics, and stories. Come discover the birthplace of New York as we know it and experience the city like a true local.

Highlights:

Journey through time and Downtown NYC the best way possible: on foot!

Explore the city with local certified guides who know every twist and turn on our world-famous streets

Benefit from a smaller sized group for a more intimate experience

Eat a real slice of New York style pizza for an authentic NYC experience

Enjoy free time to walk around the 9/11 Memorial

Our job isn’t over when the tour ends; we’ve got you covered while you’re in town with customized guides for shopping, eating out, and even the most Instagram-worthy locations to make your trip perfect

data.name: New York Tour by Subway and Bus with Private Guide
data.description: Experience New York like a real New Yorker on this private tour using subways and buses to get around.  Learn to navigate the city the way most New Yorkers do.  Get a great orientation and overview for the rest of your stay.  Visit some of the major sights, attractions and neighborhoods, along with off the beaten path places.  Discover from the beginning where you would like to go back and spend more time, during your visit.  Learn the short-cuts and secrets (maybe new just yesterday!) only known to locals.

data.name: New York City Racing Bike Rental
data.description:
Rent a Trek or Giant road bike from a Trek and Giant bike dealership.  All of our road bikes are late model year bikes.  All of our bikes are professionally maintained regularly.

Helmet(s), lock(s) and map(s) are free upon request.

Help with changing out your pedals is also available.

Customer can reschedule for any reason at no additional cost.

data.name: Central Park Running Tour
data.description: “Nature first, second, and third -- architecture after a while,” was the motto of the Central Park architects. It’s hard to imagine that everything in Central Park was put there by design, but that’s exactly what you’ll experience on The Lower Central Park running tour. The lower portion of the park features the most ambitious landscape architecture ever implemented in the United States and magically escorts the viewer out of the city and into a peaceful park surrounding.

data.name: Private Philadelphia and Amish Country Day Trip from New York
data.description: Private Philadelphia and Amish Country day trip from New York. Spend the morning in Philadelphia, America’s first World Heritage City, learn first-hand of the birthplace of place of the United States, the one-time capitol of the nation and one of the country’s oldest cities. In the afternoon, explore the countryside, learn the customs and meet some of the 31,000 Amish who make Lancaster County, Pennsylvania home. Experience life and practices as they were in the 1800s, accompanied throughout, introduced and explained by your own personal Amish/Mennonite guide living in that community.

data.name: Brooklyn 6-Hour Sightseeing Tour, with Private Driver-Guide
data.description: THIS IS A SOCIALLY DISTANCED TOUR. This private driver-guided tour takes you beyond Manhattan to Brooklyn.  Brooklyn has been called the "Soul of New York." It is a place most tourists never visit and when they do, they don't wander in very far. You are sure to experience on this tour an exciting off the beaten tourist path adventure through the very "Soul of New York."  Transportation is provided in the comfort of a roomy late model Toyota Sienna minivan, with capacity to accommodate up to six guests.  To quote an on and off the stage Brooklynite (Ralph Kramden played by Jackie Gleason), "Brooklyn, how sweet it is!" PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS PRIVATE DRIVING TOUR IS SOCIALLY DISTANCED FROM THE CROWDED CITY SIDEWALKS, SUBWAYS AND BUSES.

data.name: Manhattan Architecture Yacht Cruise
data.description:
Step aboard the teak decks of your elegant 1920s style yachts, the Manhattan and Manhattan II, and enjoy a 2.75 hour cruise while learning about NYC's architectural landmarks from the water. The "Around Manhattan" tour narration, provided by members of the American Institute of Architects’ (AIA) NYC chapter, is general enough for visitors yet detailed enough for the locals.

Experience a comfortable and unique tour through the Hudson, East, and Harlem Rivers from a glassed-in observatory cabin, which has sliding windows for a fresh breeze, or wander to an open bow for more unobstructed views of the surrounding sites. On this cruise, guests will circumnavigate the island of Manhattan (passing under all 18 bridges) while taking in monuments, architecture, parks and infrastructure with narration by a member of the AIANY Chapter.

data.name: New York City Christmas Holiday Statue & Skyline Cocoa Cruise
data.description: Experience New York from the water on this spectacular holiday cruise aboard a 1920s-style yacht. See all the major sites of Manhattan along the water at your own private table and enjoy a beverage in the glassed-in, heated observatory. Bring your family or closest friends and relax as the boat takes you out into New York Harbor. Decorated in fabulous holiday decor, this cruise is sure to get you into the holiday spirit. Capacity limitations will follow the New York State guidelines and Covid-19 modifications are in place to ensure safe cruising. Guests will be assigned private tables separated by plexiglass panes & air circulated through upgraded MERV13 Hepa filters. A great tour for families, locals and visitors alike. Light narration is provided by the captain along with some holiday tunes on our sound system. Hot beverages, beer, wine, Champagne and soda are available for purchase. One drink is complimentary.

data.name: New York to Philadelphia Private Tour with Outlet Shopping
data.description:
On this all day private tour, your driver-guide will take you Philadelphia, America’s first World Heritage City, where you will spend the morning learning first-hand of the birthplace of place of the United States, the one-time capitol of the nation and one of the country’s oldest cities.

After at lunch the Reading Market (the oldest farmers' market in the United States), your private driver-guide will take you for an afternoon of bargain shopping at a designer and brand name outet center with more than 150 stores.  After an afternoon of shopping, you will return to New York for an arrival back in the early evening - just in time for dinner.

data.name: Holiday Lights Extravaganza Walking Tour
data.description:
This small-group-sized, holiday tour is jam-packed with fun facts, stories of holiday traditions, visits to view NYC's most spectacular holiday decorations and lights, sing-a-longs, and is guided by a fun and lively Guide.

Your expert, licensed, local Guide knows all the top spots for viewing the absolute best decorated sites. They will provide expert commentary for all sites visited along the route and may assist with photo taking, if help is needed. The style of the tour is lighthearted and gay and with a genuine Christmassy vibe. All along the route, you are encouraged to take lots of memorable photographs while reveling in all the amazing sights and sounds of the holidays in super-sized, New York City style!

data.name: Crossroads of the World Running Tour
data.description: Formerly Longacre Square, Times Square entered the nation's consciousness in 1904, when it was renamed after the New York Times building that became the cornerstone of the new district. Join us on an early morning 4 mile run to see how much redevelopment has changed the neighborhood and experience the history of the theaters, restaurants, train stations and parks. See why Times Square has become the "Crossroads of the World"!

data.name: Private Washington DC Day Trip from New York
data.description: Enjoy a private day trip from New York City to Washington, DC with your own private driver-guide and vehicle. Be transported in the roomy comfort of a 2015 Toyota Sienna mini-van, with the capacity to accommodate up to six guests. This tour is value add for those who travel a substantial distance to New York City and do not anticipate returning to the region anytime soon. It is a great opportunity to visit two great cities on one trip!

data.name: The Weekender City Running Tour Package
data.description:
Join City Running Tours on two days of guided running tours throughout New York City's most well known landmarks.

Day 1 will take you on an 4 mile adventure through the world's most well know green space, Central Park. It's hard to imagine that everything you see while running through park was put there by design, but that's exactly what you'll experience on this running tour. The lower portion of the park features the most ambitious landscape architecture ever implemented in the United States and magically escorts the viewer out of the city and into a peaceful park surrounding.

Day 2 brings you on a 4 mile tour over the most iconic landmark in all of New York, the Brooklyn Bridge. At any time of day the bridge provides great views of Manhattan and Brooklyn and offers a look back at the origins of modern day New York City, when Manhattan and Brooklyn were still separate cities.

Run with us and check off your bucket list as these will be two days that you will always remember!

data.name: Central Park 5-Star Guided Bike Tour
data.description:
See the best of Central Park on a bicycle tour and discover the secrets and famous spots of this legendary park. The 2-hour tour covers all the main highlights of Central Park, including the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace, the Strawberry Fields, the Literary Walk, Cherry Hill, Belvedere Castle, and the Reservoir.
You will learn amazing facts, hear interesting park history. Discover famous movie locations and celebrity homes. During the tour, make multiple stops for photograph opportunities and short walks. The tour goes at a leisurely pace so it is perfect for riders of any skill level.

- Explore Central Park Highlights in 2-hours of fun biking.

- Cover 6 miles (10 km) of Central Park trails in a leisurely pace.

- Learn amazing facts, interesting history, movie spots & celebrity homes.

- Enjoy multiple stops for photo ops & free jokes.

- Ride high quality comfort bikes of all sizes.

data.name: Central Park NYC Electric Bike Rental
data.description:
Rent a Giant brand E-bike powered by Yamaha.  This is the best and highest quality electronic bike for rent in New York City.  We are Bike Rent NYC, the official bike tour and rental company of the NYC parks including Central Park.  Pick up your bike at our convenient location in midtown Manhattan.

Helmet(s), lock(s) and map(s) are included with your rental(s)

Adult bikes, child bikes, child trailers, and child seats are all available.

Bike baskets are available.

data.name: NYC Greenwich Village Music And Food Tour
data.description:
This walking tour of MacDougal Street explores Greenwich Village's most famous and hip street with its extensive and colorful musical history. Learn about jazz in the Village, America's left bank, and 1950's folk music, and the 1960s.

Greg Walks NYC/Gregory S. Marro and all agents/assigns/employees, are released/discharged, from/against any/all liability arising from participation in Greg Walks NYC Food Tours. data.name: Rent a bike in Central Park!
data.description:
Renting a bicycle from Bike Rent NYC means that you can pick up a high quality bicycle at our location right beside Central Park unparalleled convenience.

As the official bicycle rental of Central Park, we are equipped to provide you with a wonderful experience that you will remember for years to come.

Fun for the whole family! Children's bikes, seats, trailers, and tag-alongs are all available.

Hop on, hop off: With 12 locations around the city that you are able to pick up from and drop off at, you have all of NYC to explore!

Mobility Advocates: We offer accessible bicycles for people with disabilities.

data.name: Ultimate Insiders Brooklyn Bridge Walking Tour
data.description:
This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience the Brooklyn Bridge by learning from the great-great-grandson of the original creators. Join Metro Tours' Kriss Roebling for one of the most unique walking tours in the world! You will be able to see and touch original pieces of the Brooklyn Bridge and learn family stories of how the Brooklyn Bridge came to be one of the most famous bridges in the world. Kriss will also bring family heirlooms on tour, showing notebooks and photos of his unique connection to the world-famous bridge. There is no other tour in New York City that will allow you to get this up-close-and-personal with Kriss and his family history.

We guarantee small groups, so you have a chance to interact with Kriss and ask questions. As a result, our tours do sell out. Join Metro Tours and Kriss on this amazing walking tour!

data.name: NYC Greenwich Village World Sweets Food Tour
data.description: Take a sugary stroll through NYC's famous and funky Greenwich Village - a sweet-tooth lover's dream!

data.name: NYC Greenwich Village Italian Food Tour
data.description: This is a fun-filled interactive walking tour of Greenwich Village's Italian neighborhood. See St. Anthony's Church, Raffetto's Pasta Store and then stroll MacDougal Street's Caffe Reggio. This 2-hour tour is led by a local, licensed NYC tour guide with Italian family roots in the neighborhood for over 125 years. Your food tour guide gives you an insider's perspective into local history with music, serenades and family tales.   Samples and sights subject to change.

data.name: The Hamptons and Long Island Wineries Private Tour
data.description: On this private tour from New York City, your morning will be spent visiting the quintessential Hamptons Village of Southampton with its lovely shops, cafes, pristine beaches and ocean front mansions. Then on to Sag Harbor with its 18th Century New England-style homes, infamous yacht club, wind mill and Long Wharf.  Following a harbor-side lunch of locally harvested seafood, you will take a ferry to Shelter Island.  After a relaxing drive across the Island, a second ferry will be taken to the North Fork of Long Island - the third largest wine making region in North America with 29 wineries.  You will enjoy tastings at several different wineries, with a return to New York City early in the evening.  This will be a day to remember!

data.name: New York City Hop-On Hop-Off Pass
data.description:
- Explore New York City with one of our all-inclusive All City Pass!

data.description: On this private tour from New York City, your morning will be spent visiting the quintessential Hamptons Village of Southampton with its lovely shops, cafes, pristine beaches and ocean front mansions. Then on to Sag Harbor with its 18th Century New England-style homes, infamous yacht club, wind mill and Long Wharf.  Following a harbor-side lunch of locally harvested seafood, you will be driven to Tanger Outlets center in Riverhead, with over 200 brand name and designer outlet stores.  After an afternoon of shopping, you will be returned to New York City in time for dinner.

This 1 hour and 45 minute loop covers Times Square, the Empire State Building, the Brooklyn Bridge and much more, with each landmark illuminated after dark in the city that never sleeps.

data.name: NYC Central Park Bicycle Rentals
data.description:

data.name: Central Park, Rockefeller & Times Square Horse Carriage Ride
data.description: Welcome to Big Apples' specially combined Central Park, Rockefeller, and Times Square Tour! It starts at the corner of 59th street and 6th Avenue, following a short trip in Central Park, it continues on the famous 5th Avenue along the Apple Icon and many other historical landmarks towards Rockefeller area. Then, the rides follows the lights and the glory of the city into the Times Square area. Wandering in NYC streets at night on a horse carriage ride is certainly an experience everyone should try. There is so much to see, it is hard to list all. Depending on where you look and what you see, the content of the tour changes. At Times Square, people around the US and the world gather in a festive atmosphere day and night, cold and warm! So, being on a carriage is like watching a panoramic view of the NYC, and its people who come from all around the world to meet at this "timeless" square!

data.name: Private New York to Boston Day Trip and Tour
data.description: This is a private tour, with just your party; your personal driver-guide and a vehicle exclusively and only for you.

data.name: Private New York Christmas Tour with Driver and Guide
data.description: Soak up the sights, lights, decorations, store windows and old-fashioned holiday markets on this private tour of New York City during Christmastime. From the comfort of your private vehicle, stay warm, dry and off the crowded icy sidewalks as you cruise through NYC with a seasoned local driver-guide. Visit the iconic holiday sights of New York, as well as off-the-beaten-path local holiday gems. Because this is private tour, the itinerary can be customized according to the needs, wishes and want of the guests.

data.name: Amish Country Private Tour from New York plus Outlet Shopping
data.description: For this all day private tour, your driver-guide will take you Lancaster County in Pennsylvania - home to more than 40,000 Old Order Amish.  There, you will be joined for the morning by an Amish or Mennonite guide living in that community.  Your local guide will give you authentic first-hand exposure to the Amish.  After a lunch of Amish fare, your private driver-guide will take you for an afternoon of bargain shopping at a  designer and brand name outet center with more than 80 stores.  After shopping, you will return to New York for an arrival back in the early evening - just in time for dinner.

data.name: New York City Sunset Sail to the Statue of Liberty
data.description: Experience a sunset from New York Harbor and enjoy sweeping views of Manhattan's skyline, parts of Brooklyn and Jersey City from Schooner America 2.0, a modern tribute to the first boat that won the America's Cup in 1851. America 2.0 is 105-feet in length and has about 3600 square feet of sail area. Sail by Manhattan's Financial District, One World Trade and Ellis Island as the boat sails toward the Statue of Liberty. Enjoy up-close views of Lady Liberty and a great photo opportunity as the sun dips below the horizon. This trip is perfect for couples, friends, visitors and locals. Adult ticketing applies to all travelers.

data.name: Hop-On Hop-Off New York Bus Tour with Statue of Liberty Ticket and More
data.description:
Enjoy the best New York sightseeing experience with our Downtown Tour (Same Day), Downtown Tour (Same Day) + Statue of Liberty Cruise, or Limited City Pass (48 Hours). With the flexibility to hop on and hop off near all major NYC attractions, you can explore the points of interest at your convenience, and check off all the spots you want to visit without hassles. 

You will sure find what fits your needs from the three different product offerings. For an individual hop-on hop-off NYC bus tour, use Downtown Tour (Same Day). If you want to add a Statue of Liberty visit, Downtown Tour (Same Day) + Statue of Liberty Cruise is the right choice. For a more comprehensive NYC experience, opt for Limited City Pass (48 Hours) to enjoy Downtown Tour (hop-on hop-off), Uptown & Harlem (hop-on hop-off), Statue of Liberty Cruise, and Central Park bike rental.

data.name: Pedicab Tour through Central Park, Rockefeller & Times Square
data.description:
This is the only tour that goes through the three most famous landmarks in New York City: Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square.

Start your tour at the corner of 59th street and 6th Avenue, following a short trip in Central Park and continue along the famous 5th Avenue past the Apple Icon and many other historical landmarks towards the Rockefeller area. Next, your ride follows the lights and the glory of the city into the Times Square area. Wandering in NYC streets at night on a pedicab is certainly an experience everyone should try. Depending on where you look and what you see, the content of the tour changes. At Times Square, people around the US and the world gather in a festive atmosphere day and night, cold and warm! This carriage experience will provide you with a panoramic view of NYC, and its people who come from all around the world to meet at this "timeless" square!

data.name: Electric Scooter Rental NYC
data.description:
We provide top quality Electric Scooters for rental at competitive prices and 5-Star service. All Scooters are New, Well Maintained and Clean. Our store is located in the heart of Manhattan right next to Central Park, which makes it a convenient place for pick up and drop off.
Our Scooters have long range up to 40 miles (64 km), their light weight and foldable so you can easily cary them anywhere. Also equipped with a phone and water bottle holder.

data.name: Private Central Park Guided Tour by Pedicab
data.description: Discover Central Park from a different perspective on a 1-hour or 2-hour tour led by a professional licensed pedicab operator and guide. Enjoy panoramic views of all landmarks on the smooth ride, learn parks rich history & interesting facts, stop along the way for photo ops and short walks at the most famous landmarks.

data.name: New York City Sunset Cruise on Yacht Manhattan
data.description: Enjoy a 1.5-hour cruise along the Hudson River and New York Harbor on a classic 1920s-style yacht. Pass by Manhattan's financial district, One World Trade, Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. Take in the beautiful skyline as the sun dips below the horizon. This is a great way to see Manhattan for visitors and locals alike and a great photo opportunity as well.

data.name: NYC Greenwich Village Meatball Tasting Food Tour
data.description: This seasonal tour runs from Tuesday, September 7, 2021 to Friday, May 27, 2022, it's the perfect time for a warm, flavorful steamy meatball. This meatball crawl is a fun and yummy meatball tasting tour. Enjoy filling, tasty, mouth watering meatballs - Venetian, Sicilian, Neopolitan, Spanish, followed by a decadent dessert from Rocco's Italian Pastry Shop; Greenwich Village's last Italian pastry shop. All samples and sites subject to change.

data.name: Compagnie des Bateaux Mouches Bastille Day Seine River Dinner Cruise
data.description: Have a Champagne dinner cruise, taste a French traditional cooking, prepared on board by our own chef. Enjoy a 2h15 magic cruise with live music! At the end of the dinner, make yourself comfortable and watch the firework display from the upper-deck.

data.name: Luxury private day tour to Champagne from Paris
data.description: With this luxury day tour to Champagne, we make sure that you visit and taste only the best the region has to offer. We have crafted this trip with hand picked partners so you can have a perfect experience from start to finish. From the discovery of one of the world’s most prestigious Champagne producers, like Champagne Dom Pérignon or Champagne Ruinart, to the visit of a confidential winery making rare & haute couture champagnes to the passion of your guide who will share his knowledge about wine and Champagne, which is the result of a perfect blend between the land, the climate and century old craftsmanship, this is a perfect day around the world’s most illustrious drink, symbol of prestige and great achievements. Enjoy an exclusive gourmet lunch at a Michelin * restaurant, paired with wines. This tour includes hôtel pick up and drop off by air-conditioned black car or minivan and your private wine expert guide.

data.name: Guided Visit and Wine Tasting in a Royal Wine Cellar in Paris
data.description: Visit a royal wine cellar in the heart of Paris: discover and learn about French wine in a fun and interactive experience !

data.name: Paris Dark Side Walking Tour
data.description:
Our Dark Paris private tour is the ideal way to unveil the most secret & mysterious legends of the City of Lights. From the Antic Latin Quarter to Notre Dame surroundings, and from the Marais to the Haunted Châtelet. It won’t leave you indifferent. Secure your spot now!

Enjoy a private Paris Evening Tour with a Local Expert Guide.

Explore the medieval heart of Paris, where each street corner hides stories to reveal.

Decipher hidden symbols & gothic statues by the churches where dreadful stories happened.

Discover back alleys where criminals & alchemists haunted for centuries.

From the Middle Ages to the 1960s, unveil the darkness behind the Parisian nightlife.

The iconic centre of Paris and Notre Dame cathedral will never look the same after this unique experience!

data.name: Bistro Parisien 3-Course-Lunch and Seine River Sightseeing Cruise
data.description:
Climb aboard a pleasure boat for a 1-hour cruise down the River Seine, before or after your 3-course-lunch including a drink at the Bistro Parisien on the quay near the Eiffel Tower.

Take your seats in an entirely glassed-over boat, and enjoy panoramic views of the finest parts of Paris. Relax to the background music you learn the history of Paris, from its medieval origins on the Ile de la Cité, to the secrets of some of its mansions.

Glide past the golden dome of Les Invalides, see the elegant Musée d’Orsay, admire the palatial home of the Louvre Museum,pass the historic exhibition hall of the Grand Palais, and much more.

Lunch is served from 11:00 to 15:00, meaning you are free to take it before or after your cruise. Enjoy views of the Eiffel Tower from the Bistro Parisien.

The chef uses seasonal products to prepare tasty and authentic cuisine for your enjoyment.

data.name: Walk & Wine Tour in the Latin Quarter
data.description: You will meet in the wine shop and tasting place called" Wine Tasting In Paris" offering the best wine experience in the city for more than 5 years. After a first glass of wine with the owner of the place, a French Sommelier, you will leave withy your guide for 2 hours of walking in the charming small streets of Latin Quarter. You will see amazing places such as the Roman Arena, The food street of Rue Mouffetard, The Pantheon, The Sorbonne University. After the first glass of wine in the wine tasting place, you will have 3 more stops,In the small delicious cheese shop first where you will have a second glass of wine with a selection of French cheese, then you will stop in an hidden wine bar behind the Pantheon to taste some natural and organic wines, then you will have a last stop in a wine and finger food place wich is perfect for a French apperitif. Here you will have your last glass and food included in the tour.... but of course you can stay there and have more drinks on your own!

data.name: Street freestyle scooter courses in Paris
data.shortDescription: Discover scooter riding in the best parisian spots! This 1 to 5 day scooter course is sure to have you rolling and jumping in no time!
data.description:
You've already been to the skateparks near your home and need a change and new advice? Meet the pros from Street Trott Klub for a scooter course in Paris!

The proposed courses are aimed at children who are already autonomous on their scooter and who have enough stamina.
They will allow you to gain level and confidence in all riding situations in the city and in skate parks.
The groups will be formed according to the level, from the beginner with a minimum of autonomy in the wheels to the improvement of curve and street.

Program :
- 10:30 am: Meeting at the PSC office (26 rue au Maire, 75003 Paris), at the Arts et Métiers station on lines 3 or 11.
- Meeting and presentation of the group
- Briefing on the day's itinerary
- 11am: departure by scooter or metro to one of the many spots in Ile de France
- Coaching, advice and fun exercises to progress
- Lunch break (bring a picnic)
- Debriefing on the morning session
- Departure to another spot (trott or metro)
- Snack break (bring cereal bar, cake)
- 17h - 18h : Return to the PSC room depending on the traffic

data.name: Skateboarding course in Paris
data.shortDescription: Your child is a skateboarding fan and wants to learn the basics, progress and discover his first or new tricks?
data.description:
Your child is a skateboarding fan and wants to learn the basics, progress and discover his first or new tricks? This course is made for him! Indeed, this course is aimed at children who are already able to ride and brake on their boards and wish to learn new tricks or improve their skateboarding skills in Paris.

Students will participate in street and skatepark sessions, supervised by qualified teachers who are passionate about skateboarding and used to working with children.

Thanks to this course, your child will be able to progress in skateboarding in a very nice atmosphere in Paris and its surroundings!

Program
- 10:30am: Meeting at the Paris Skate Culture office (26 rue au Maire, 75003 Paris), at the Arts et Métiers station on lines 3 or 11.
- Meeting and presentation of the group
- Briefing on the itinerary of the day
- 11am: departure by skateboard or metro to one of the many skate spots in the Ile de France
